summary: Detective Psyduck (no wait its pikachu ) Review (semi spoilers)
title: Detective Psyduck (no wait its pikachu ) Review (semi spoilers)
body:
I walked into this movie excited but honestly, nervous. This game was the first ever video game I played at 10 years old. I played pretend in the playground as a psyduck, I traded and collected the cards, and my ds was with me 24/7. I was afraid that my childhood dreams of a real life Pokemon world might be crush if this movie didn’t perform well. 

I can honestly say though, my fears where quelled during the first view of Rhyme City.

This movie was everything I hoped for. The cinematography was absolutely stunning and the Pokemon where realistic yet still cute. They where able to capture what being in the Pokemon world would be like. The subtle nods to other regions and even the top view of the new Galar region was so cool!! the way Pokemon and people worked together was completely perfect. And of course, my favorite Pokemon being a main side character didn’t hurt ;P

That doesnt mean they didnt mess up on a few things. I was disappointed that death was a real fear in pokemon battles, but I guess that is understandable. But when Pikachu was hit once with a small falling rock and nearly died, I thought that was a bit much. Especially since he survived a full car crash. 

 Pokeballs also didn’t expand, they just stayed the same size, which was really disappointing to me. I also wish there where more battle scenes, The Gengar and Blastoise battle made me cry (happy tears) and I just wish I could have seen more of that. Though the battle between Mewtwo and Pikachu was AWESOME!!. 


now lets get into the Pokemon im most excited that we saw. 

PSYDUCK- I remember first seeing this little yellow duck in a herd on route 210 in the Sinnoh region. His pokedex entry really spoke to me, seeing as I suffered a deliberating illness that I also couldn’t control. At that moment, when I healed them and saw the little duck waddle in the wrong direction, I knew this was my favorite Pokemon. And he has been, for over 10 years. Im so glad to see him finally getting the recognition he deserved. The merch, the art, the love that I knew he could get!!! Before this movie I would hunt throughout the internet for anything with my favorite duck on it, and I was lucky if I even found a deformed keychain. Now? I have two cups, a plush, and I plan on getting anything else with this cute yellow face.

They also did this duck amazing justice. He is adorable, goofy, and extremely powerful. I loved his dynamic with Pikachu and how his trainer knew exactly how to handle him. His little backpack sling is exactly how I would take my Psyduck places!! (heck I take my dog in a little bag). All in all, Psyduck was my favorite part of this movie, and I hope we see more of him in any new movie they decide to release

This was just a short review of the pokemon movie that Iv been wanting to post, im in no way a professional. If you disagree with me that fine! I hope you have a good day! thanks for reading!

blog.name: claidi
blog.title: Stuff
blog.description:
Randomness Incarnate.
---------------------------
Or, well this is a blog that exists. I used to be a fandom blog but at this point I'm just random reblog soup. So what can you actually expect from me? Funny stuff, cute stuff- I try to keep this mostly positive and drama free. Recently, besides the general stuff that goes around I post about games and anime. Think like Xenoblade, Kingdom Hearts, Persona 5 ect. 
You can find me on Fanfiction.net at Unformal Sorrelle and AO3 as Unformal_Sorrelle. I'm mostly a gen writer who goes all over fandomwise. I don't mind talking about my fics, and I'll sometimes post about them so there's that. Just a note, Fanfiction.net has basically everything while my AO3 is newer and only really has my more polished works.
Anyways, sorry for all my cluttered blerg and hopefully I'll keep posting whatever you're interested in!

tags: it was an awesome experience and i loved it
summary: I think one of the most exciting things about Detective Pikachu is just how excited it was to be a Pokemon movie. A lot of times...
body:
I think one of the most exciting things about Detective Pikachu is just how excited it was to be a Pokemon movie. A lot of times you have a very wide separation between an adaptations movie universe and the source material. Fantasy worlds become Generic Fantasy Setting tm and anything too unique gets put in “our” reality with a few matching names and similar designs. I mean, just compare Detective Pikachu to the Sonic trailer, where the cast seems widdled down to two actual Sonic characters with a random dude seeming like the main character with Sonic being the weird plot device character from another world. It’s not so much a Sonic movie as a Alvin and the Chipmunks/Smurfs/random live action adaptation. Meanwhile, Detective Pikachu is a Pokemon movie. It wouldn’t work as well as anything else.

It not just all the detail the backgrounds got. It’s not just when they used the indigo league opening. It’s telling the audience that the main character’s mother is dead with a cubone. It’s using the themes of Pokemon to tell a story about connection. It’s all those little references, using what you may know about Pokemon, to engage with the mystery. Detective Pikachu works as a Pokemon movie because it never tries to be something else.

Detective Pikachu starts us in the new region, tells us the quirks, and runs with it. This is not The Live Action Pokemon Movie. It’s a Pokemon move that just so happens to be live action. It can slot into the Pokemon world just as smoothly as the new Galar region. One of the appealing things about the franchise has always been how fun the world looks to be a part of, and Detective Pikachu definitely understands this. Anyways, it’s GOOD!

summary: For good reasons, I doodled over the image to censor out Mama’s face. Like they say, what goes on the internet stays on the...
caption:
For good reasons, I doodled over the image to censor out Mama’s face. Like they say, what goes on the internet stays on the internet.
Anywho! Mama and I ended up going to see Detective Pikachu this morning. We decided to have fun and take my Charizard, that I’ve had since 2001, and my Pikachu, that I’ve had since 2004/2005. Since it was an early showing, not many people were there, so I don’t know if we got questioning looks or what. However, the guy at the concession stand was amused when he saw them, even wanted me to set them on the counter (since no one was there) so he could get a picture of them.
Now I wanna go back and watch the movie again….

For good reasons, I doodled over the image to censor out Mama’s face. Like they say, what goes on the internet stays on the internet.
Anywho! Mama and I ended up going to see Detective Pikachu this morning. We decided to have fun and take my Charizard, that I’ve had since 2001, and my Pikachu, that I’ve had since 2004/2005. Since it was an early showing, not many people were there, so I don’t know if we got questioning looks or what. However, the guy at the concession stand was amused when he saw them, even wanted me to set them on the counter (since no one was there) so he could get a picture of them.
Now I wanna go back and watch the movie again….

tags: there were pikachu and psyduck and meowth and zubat
and some kind of blue seal thing from one of the games I don't have
I'm pretty sure it's the water type starter for that region but I don't know what it's called
there were just loads of cuddly pokemon
and I thought it would be a stupid idea to bring a cuddly toy along in my snack bag on an impulse
(Stephen was just right next to the bag when I was getting ready to leave)
(So was my Squirtle toy but that one was twice the gengar's size)
summary: Went to see Detective Pikachu. A whole bunch of people (myself included) brought a small cuddly pokemon with them. It was the...
body:
Went to see Detective Pikachu.

A whole bunch of people (myself included) brought a small cuddly pokemon with them.

It was the most blessed crowd I’d ever been a part of.
